See how we work

Why invest in detailed as-built reality?

A site visit is one of the smallest costs in the project and one of the biggest levers on risk—cutting change orders, protecting dates, and helping you avoid bad buildings. Learn how it pays for itself.

How it works

A simple, repeatable process on every site.

  1. Step 1

    Clarify the decision

    We align on what you’re deciding—renew vs. relocate, fund vs. defer, re-use vs. rebuild—and what your team needs to see.

  2. Step 2

    Lock access & dates

    We coordinate with building management, security, and your stakeholders, then book travel under our national flight pass.

  3. Step 3

    Capture the reality

    On site we follow a disciplined route to document structure, services, access, and any conditions that affect design, cost, or schedule. On-site visuals, notes, measurements, and observations are captured in real time using our internal ScopeWalk™ system, ensuring consistent structure and clarity across every visit.

  4. Step 4

    Deliver decision-ready outputs

    You receive a digital twin, labeled photos, and a detailed report with fixture counts, a high-level mechanical overview, and prioritised recommendations.

Deliverables

What you receive on every visit.

Same structure, every time—so your team can line sites up side-by-side and move quickly.

Visuals

  • Digital twin or 360° walkthrough of the space
  • Full, detailed video walkthrough with narration
  • Labeled photo storyboard by area and topic
  • Context shots of access, loading, parking, neighbors
  • Optional drone stills & clips where allowed

Documentation

  • Detailed measurements according to brief
  • Fixture & services counts (lights, diffusers, sprinklers, doors, WCs, key equipment)
  • Detailed written conditions report with a high-level mechanical / services overview
  • Upsides and concerns clearly highlighted
  • Recommendations prioritised into P1 / P2 / P3 so you know what to act on first

Who we work with

Built for teams making decisions on space at scale.

Landlords & asset managers Tenants & workplace teams Brokers & project managers Private equity & lenders Design-build & GC partners

Typical use cases include pre-lease diligence, renew-vs-relocate analysis, rollout programmes, independent progress verification, and lender / investor updates.

Where we operate

Alturascope currently covers the United States and Canada under a national flight-pass model.

  • Major metros, secondary markets, and many tertiary locations
  • Office, flex, industrial, retail, and healthcare / clinic spaces
  • One-off sites or multi-market portfolios

Looking for coverage in the United Kingdom? Visit Alturascope UK for U.K.-specific services and pricing.

Example engagements

Where Alturascope fits into real projects.

Renew vs. relocate

Office landlord with expiring lease

We documented an existing tenant space and two alternatives, highlighting base-build gaps, services constraints, and quick-win upgrades so the asset team could structure a renewal that made financial sense.

Roll-out readiness

Behavioural health & clinic expansion

For a PE-backed clinic group, we captured new locations before lease and construction, checking bathroom counts, access, and services to support their programme and lender requirements.

Lender & investor support

Independent progress verification

We provided fixed-route progress photography, a digital twin, and exceptions log so a lender could track risk on a renovation draw schedule without flying their own team in.

Ready to move a site forward?

Share the address, approximate size, and what you’re deciding. We’ll confirm the scope, recommend the right visit type, and send a simple, all-in quote.
